results.title: How to marry a millionaire
results.creator_credit: Nunnally Johnson, Jean Negulesco and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marilyn”.
Lauren Bacall, Betty Grable and Marilyn Monroe are three glamorous models on the lookout for a rich man. Pooling their funds, they decide to rent a luxurious Manhattan penthouse in order to lure their catch. Things are not what they appear to be as two of them fall in love with “poor men.” In the attempt to stop each other from marrying the wrong man, the threesome give their best performances. Utimately, it is love and not money which influences their choices. This film is a must see for lovers of Marilyn Monroe’s quirky and individualistic comedy style.

results.title: How to manage the boss
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, BNA Communications and Ameron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
The subordinate must be able to “read” the boss, to be able to communicate, to prevent “surprises” - problems and crises that could have been anticipated. Bosses need support from the staff, which if given will augment personal effectiveness. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: How to make the organization work for you
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, BNA Communications and Ameron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Rules, procedures and good manners are essential, but flexibility is needed. No organisation can operate solely “by the book”. Accomplishment should be the aim, not solely promotion. Outside interests should be developed as a buffer against possible disappointments in the later stages of one’s career. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: How to make a movie without a camera
results.creator_credit: Rainy Day Productions, Michael Warshaw and Mimi Warshaw
results.brief_description: Presents the results of efforts made to produce a film without a camera, using the following techniques to produce striking effects: vegetable dye colouring, felt-tipped pen, sprays and fingerprints all individually applied to clear leader; and scratching and perforating of opaque leader. The film is especially useful to young filmmakers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Rainy Day Productions, Michael Warshaw and Mimi Warshaw

results.title: How to keep from catching VD
results.brief_description: A health officer addresses a class of secondary school students about gonorrhea and syphilis. Using charts, he explains the immediate and long-range effects of each disease. Stress is placed on the possible prevention of the diseases through selective sexual behaviour, cleanliness and the use of mechanical devices.

results.title: How to judge facts
results.brief_description: Designed to help students develop a technique for fact-finding, this film tells the story of a high school student who writes a sensational story for his school newspaper; his fellow students begin to learn to discount platitudes, false analogies, unfounded assumptions, and double meanings.
